text: The U.S. Special Presidential Envoy for Climate is a position in the Government of the United States with authority over energy policy within the executive branch. ==Special Presidential Envoy for Climate== In November 2020, President-elect Joe Biden announced former U.S. Secretary of State John Kerry would serve as his Special Presidential Envoy for Climate. On January 31, 2024, it was announced that John Podesta would replace John Kerry as envoy. ==List of Envoys== No. Portrait Officeholder Term start Term end President John Kerry January 20, 2021 March 6, 2024 Joe Biden John Podesta March 6, 2024 January 20, 2025 ==References== Category:United States Executive Cabinet
